forum.content:
Let politics go back to where it belongs

If this happened to anyone who waved a flag to serve a political purpose, I would probably say, "Why not?",
and I would respect that because as a citizen in a democracy, that's what we value
You have every right to disapprove, as long as it is legitimate

It's already an everyday scene here in Taiwan that we fight against each other owing to different political grounds

But we're talking about a sixteen-year-old girl who has long been away from home, hard-working and maybe a little bit homesick, waving a flag that represents where she comes from
There's no political intention in doing that at all

People shouldn't appreciate any forms of art first thing based on the performer's nationality
Hope there's only a small part of people who do so and I'd rather think that most people are still reasonable

It is universal that politics should stay where it belongs, and it should not intervene in any forms of art, or any other irrelevant event
forum.title: "Sharing"
